key_risks: Legal and financial challenges including shareholder lawsuits and executive disputes
Dependency on the real estate market making it vulnerable to sector downturns
Intensifying competition from rivals like Zillow 3D Home and Cupix
High costs of premium 3D capture devices limiting adoption among smaller businesses
Data privacy risks associated with cloud-based platform and AI-driven analytics
controversies: Shareholder lawsuits alleging unfair benefits to insiders over common stockholders in the sale to CoStar Group
Legal dispute with former CEO Bill Brown claiming $79 million in damages
Claims from legacy shareholders due to the 2021 SPAC merger
social_issues: Data privacy risks and ethical considerations in AI development and spatial data processing
governance_issues: Executive disputes and shareholder lawsuits indicating potential governance issues
Concerns over the adequacy of disclosures in the sale to CoStar Group

sources.title: More Woes for Matterport as Fired Exec Claims Company Cooked Its Books ...
sources.snippet: The company is already facing the prospect of having to pay its former CEO, Bill Brown $79 million in a dispute over a share lockup period. Matterport's shareholders recently voted to accept CoStar's proposed $1.6 billion takeover deal. Although CoStar group has not commented on either lawsuit, it may well be digging deeper.

sources.title: Claims Of Legacy Shareholders Against Matterport, Inc.
sources.snippet: In July 2021, Matterport's predecessor, legacy Matterport, effectively went public via a business combination transaction in which it merged with and into a wholly-owned subsidiary of Matterport. This business combination transaction entitled legacy shareholders to receive public shares of the new Matterport.
